title:
Convergence of the hydrodynamic gradient expansion in relativistic
  kinetic theory
abstract:
We rigorously prove that, in any relativistic kinetic theory whose
non-hydrodynamic sector has a finite gap, the Taylor series of all hydrodynamic
dispersion relations has a finite radius of convergence. Furthermore, we prove
that, for shear waves, such radius of convergence cannot be smaller than $1/2$
times the gap size. Finally, we prove that the non-hydrodynamic sector is
gapped whenever the total scattering cross-section (expressed as a function of
the energy) is bounded below by a positive non-zero constant. These results,
combined with well-established covariant stability criteria, allow us to derive
a rigorous upper bound on the shear viscosity of relativistic dilute gases.
